title: Present Simple Tense
description: Learn the basics of present simple tense formation and usage

content.explanation: The present simple tense is used to describe habits, facts, and general truths.
examples: The sun rises in the east.
rules: Use base form of verb for I, you, we, they
Add -s or -es for he, she, it
Use do/does for questions and negatives

title: Articles: A, An, The
description: Master the correct usage of definite and indefinite articles

content.explanation: Articles are words that define a noun as specific or unspecific.

title: Past Simple vs Present Perfect
description: Understand when to use past simple versus present perfect tense

content.explanation: Past simple is for completed actions at specific times, present perfect connects past to present.
examples: I visited Paris last year. (past simple)
rules: Past simple: specific time in the past
Present perfect: experience or continuing relevance

title: Prepositions of Time
description: Learn when to use at, in, on for time expressions

content.explanation: Prepositions of time show when something happens.

title: Subject and Object Pronouns
description: Distinguish between subject pronouns (I, you, he) and object pronouns (me, you, him)

content.explanation: Subject pronouns perform the action, object pronouns receive the action.
examples: I see him. (I = subject, him = object)
She gave me a book. (she = subject, me = object)
rules: Subject pronouns: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
Object pronouns: me, you, him, her, it, us, them

title: First Conditional
description: Learn to express real possibilities with if-clauses

content.explanation: First conditional expresses real or likely future situations.
examples: If it rains, I will stay home.
If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
rules: If + present simple, will + base verb
Can use unless instead of if not

title: Comparative and Superlative Adjectives
description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives correctly

content.explanation: Comparative adjectives compare two things, superlatives compare three or more.
Present continuous describes actions happening right now or temporary situations.
examples: She is studying English this year.
